subject: p17340686
History: Hypoxia despite 4 L nasal cannula, dialysis cut short yesterday due to leg pain.
Findings: Mild pulmonary edema is improved from prior exam. Dilated main pulmonary artery is seen, compatible with pulmonary arterial hypertension. No large effusion is seen on this supine film. There is no pneumothorax. The cardiac silhouette is moderately enlarged but stable. Left-sided double lumen central venous catheter is seen with tip in the right atrium. Degenerative changes are seen in the right humeral head, better characterized on the dedicated exam. Surgical sutures are noted in the right upper quadrant.
Impression: Mild pulmonary edema, improved from the prior study. Dilated main pulmonary artery, compatible with pulmonary arterial hypertension.
